task.title: Starting, stopping, and resetting an Android Virtual Device (AVD)

taskbody.prereq: You must have an existing AVD, listed in the Device Management view.

step.cmd: Click the Device Management tab, if necessary, to bring forward the Device Management view.

Double-click an offline AVD to start it. Similarly, double-click an online AVD to stop it. Or, in the Device Management view, right-click the AVD you wish to start, stop, or reset and select the desired operation from the menu that appears.
step.info: Note that when starting or resetting an AVD, it must not already be running. Also note that if you launch one of your Android projects using a run configuration that targets an AVD, and that AVD is not yet running, it will be started automatically for you.

taskbody.postreq: You can also start, stop, or reset multiple AVDs at one time by selecting the AVDs and clicking the appropriate command icon at the top of the Device Management View.
